intro: Dyschoriste pseuderecta, commonly known as the false upright dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of purple and blue. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
